question: The core of Saul's disobedience was that_____________
explanation: Saul actually carried out Gods assignment to destroy Amalek. The gist of his disobedience was that he didn't perform this assignment according to the prescribed instructions, he spared Agag and reserved choice animals for himself
options: He refused to carry out God's assignment on eliminating the Amalekites
He didn't perform the task of smiting Amalekites to the letter
He preserved the booty for himself

question: God instructed Saul to utterly destroy Amalek because___________
explanation: God punished the Amalekites primarily because they obstructed the Israelites on the way after the latter had escaped Egypt
options: He abhors Idolatory and all forms of Unrighteousness
Its people opposed the Israelites on the way after departing Egypt
Its people encouraged Israel to disobey God
Samuel had prayed for it destruction

question: One of the most significant lessons from the emergence of Deborah as a leader is that_________
explanation: Even at a time when Israel had no regard for women's perspective in leadership, Deborah's rare leadership quality and value of her advice especially during Jabin's oppression of Israel is by far the most significant lesson surrounding her 'emergence' and recognition as their leader.
options: She not only prophesied but also advised Israel
Gender difference isn't a limitation to leadership
Honesty and Integrity are key to leadership
One needs to summon courage as a leader to solve problems

question: Jeremiah prophesied God's punishment of the Israelites because they had_______
explanation: The Israelites forsaked the worship of God, who had brought them out of Egypt, for the worship of foreign gods. Jeremiah prophecy surrounded this with the message of hope in case of repentance.
options: Committed atrocities with their neighbors' wives

question: Jesus healed the lame man who had been sick for thirty-eight years at?
explanation: Bethsheba, specifically at the pool of Bethsheba by the Sheep Gate in Jerusalem, Jesus healed the lame man on a sabbath

question: St Paul's condition for the attainment of justification is by ______?
explanation: In St Paul's viewpoint, we can only be justified by faith in the resurrection of Christ Jesus and by mere strict obedience to the law. He used the example of Abraham to support his stance.

question: The model example for wives in Christian families according to St Peter is _____
explanation:
Sarah is the correct answer.

St Peter advised that wives look up to Sarah, who hoped in God and referred to her Husband in Obedience as Lord.

question: According to Luke, Jesus was standing by the......He thereafter entered into the boat preaching and later 'calling' Simon Peter __________
explanation: The Lake of Gennesaret is the Correct answer, as according to luke, this was where Jesus stood before entering the boat to instruct Simon peter to cast his net into the sea for a ctach and later calling his as a disciple

question: One significance of St Paul's teaching on Resurrection is that__________
explanation: The resurrection of Christ is the basis of the Christian Faith, it is the hope of salvation upon which Christians rely
options: Christians must not underestimate the power of baptism by immersion
As Christ rose and ascended into glory, so as also must uphold the observance of law
The foundation of their hope of salvation is in Christ's resurrection
The second coming of Christ is near
The second coming of Christ is near

question: Jesus charged Christians to express love just as________
explanation: Christians are to show love to everyone as Jesus Christ did when he made the supreme sacrifice for mankind through the shedding of his blood
options: He taught them the new commandment
They would do with their neighbours
He laid his life for the sake of mankind

question: Elijah fed on _____ after declaring drought upon the land of Israel
explanation: After his pronouncement of drought upon Israel, Elijah fed on 'bread, meat and water'

question: A Christian can demonstrate that he is light of the world by___________
explanation: Being a light of the world, a Christian must Endeavour to uphold good moral value so much so that non-believers may emulate this for general social progress
options: Advocating for the meek to inherit the earth
being merciful to persons in need

question: Peter healed Aeneas who had been bedridden for ____ years?
explanation: Aeneas had been paralysed for eight years before Peter healed him

question: St. Peter's teaching on Civic Responsibility centers upon_____
explanation: St Peter emphasized on the qualities of a good citizens which includes, among other things, respecting the authorities

question: St Paul, in 'Law and Grace', although man was condemned, he has been redeemed through the _____
explanation: St Paul explained that mankind was condemned because of the Sin of Adam, but through the Grace of God and the righteousness in Jesus, Mankind was redeemed
options: Compliance to the laws of the God

question: Summarily, St Paul in his teaching on 'New Life In Christ' advised Christains to ______
explanation: All in all, St Paul advised that Christians make the word of Christ their guiding principle which should dwell richly in them.
options: Endeavor to be baptized by immersion
Pray for the Grace of God
Dwell richly in the word of God

question: The core of St Paul's advice on dignity of Labour is that
explanation: The gist of St.Paul's teaching on "Dignity of Labour' is that laziness and indolence must not be condoned. Hence Christians must be productive.
options: Christians must work hard to actively support the Church and themselves
The lazy people must be made to learn in the hardest way possible
Everyone should actively contribute to social progress

question: Peter advised Christians to _______as they were sharing Christ's sufferings
explanation: Seeing as their reward is in heaven and that they share in the burden of Christ, St Peter advised that Christians "rejoice" even in the midst of suffering.

question: The accusation of blasphemy against Moses, the law and God was levied against _______
explanation: The Jews falsely accused Stephen of Blasphemy against Moses, the Law and God and that he claimed Jesus would destroy the temple.

question: St. James in the teaching on faith and work gave the analogy of ________
explanation: St James liked his teaching on Faith and work to the situation of a hungry man who approached his fellow Christian for help but who was rather told to "Go in Peace; be warmed and filled'.
options: A man who looks himself in the mirror and appreciates God for that
A hungry man who approached his fellow Christian for help
A man of little faith encouraging others to work
A poor man with wretched clothing approaching the rich for help

question: One of the following is not a condition for effective prayer according to St James_____
explanation: Lowliness is not considered a condition for effective prayer by Christians according to St James

question: To St Paul, Christians can prepare for the second coming of Christ by______
explanation: All that Christians have to do in preparation for the second coming of Christ is to live righteous lives with strong faith in the redemptive work of Christ
options: Spreading the message of Christ's coming far and wide

question: The significance of the last supper is evident in all but one of the following-------
explanation: All the other options reveal Jesus usage of the last supper to foretell certain events except that he re-established the Lord's covenant with his children through Abraham
options: Prediction of the suffering and death of Jesus
Re-establishment of the Lord's covenant with his Children
The prophecy of Peter's denial of Jesus

question: St. Paul showed commitment as a means upon which forgiveness can effectively thrive by_______
explanation: St.Paul demonstrated to Philemon that he truly wanted him to forgive Onesimus by undertaking the extra responsibility of paying whatever sum Onesimus owed
options: Appealing to Philemon to forgive Onesimus and accept him back as brother
Asking that Philemon to Charge to his account whatever Onesimus owed
Instructing Philemon to write off all the debts of Onesimus, if any compassionately

question: The triumphal entry was in fulfilment of the prophecy of_______
explanation: Prophet Zechariah foretold the Truimphal Entry of Jesus

question: "I gave you cleanness of teeth in all your cities". By this statement, God gave them ______
explanation: God's message to Prophet Amos on the Failure of the Israelites to repent despite plaguing them with hunger and scarcity. (Amos 4:6)

question: God instructed Saul to utterly destroy Amalek because_____
explanation: God punished the Amalekites primarily because they obstructed the Israelites on the way after the latter had escaped Egypt
options: Its people encouraged Israel to disobey God
He abhors Idolatory and all forms of unrighteousness
Samuel had prayed for its destruction
Its people opposed the Israelites on the way, after departing Egypt

question: St. Paul had already boasted to the ______and for this reason he sent a reminder letter to the ______ on Christian giving
"It shall be neither mine nor yours; divide it" what was to be divided?
explanation: Reference here is made to the wise decision of King Solomon in deciding the case of the two women contesting ove a Live Baby

question: St. Paul's teaching on forgiveness primarily shows that________
explanation: St Paul emphasized the reception of Onesimus back by Philemon despite his inadequacies, that he (Paul) will cover the costs. But this time, not as a mere servant but as a brother in the Lord
options: Subordinates must regard their superiors and vice-versa for forgiveness to thrive
Genuine forgiveness only comes from God
Christians must not institute a 'Master-Servant' relationship contract
Philemon had unilaterally decided not to accept Onesimus back

question: The model example in St. Paul teaching on humility is _______
explanation: St Paul used the example of Jesus Christ, who through his humility, became elevated as Lord.

question: The core of Saul's disobedience was that___________
explanation: Saul actually carried out God's assignment to destroy Amalek. The gist of his disobedience was that he didn't perform this assignment according to the prescribed instructions, he spared Agag and reserved choice animals for himself
options: He didn't perform the task of smiting the Amalekites to the letter
He preserved the booty for himself
He refused to carry out God's assignment on eliminating the Amalekites

question: The Lord protected the Israelites with all but one of the following when the Egyptians chased them
explanation: The Lord used his Angels, pillar of cloud and darkness to obstruct the view of the Egyptians when they pursued the Israelites

question: One derivative lesson from the story of Gehazi'z greed is that_______
explanation: Ghazi not only destroyed himself but also ruined the lives of his descendants (The curse of leprosy upon him and his generations forever) as a result of greed and dishonesty.
options: We can by ourselves, through materialism, cause the destruction of generations yet unborn
Dishonesty should not have been a ground for cursing Gehazi with leprosy
As servants of God we must endeavour not to readily demand gifts from those we help
We should be wary of accepting gifts from the unrighteous

question: Paul advised the young in his teaching on interpersonal relationship among Christains to ________
explanation: The youth according to ST Peter should be respectful and submissive to the elders in the Church. Whilst the elders lead exemplary lives
options: See themselves as strong and able-bodied servants of God

question: According to St James, 'He who keeps the whole law and fails in one is guilty of....'
explanation: St James advised Christians against partiality and corruption, saying that if they keep the whole law and fail in one by showing partiality
options: Breaking the new commandment of Christ
Breaking that particular love and should pray for grace

question: On the ________day, the child was _______and named Jesus
explanation: According to the account of Luke, Jesus was circumcised and named "Jesus' on the eight day

question: One of the most significant lessons from the healing of the Centurion's Servant is that ____________
explanation: Despite the fact that the Centurion was a Roman and not a Jew, Jesus healed his servant. This shows that salvation is open to all. NB; It was the Centurion's level of faith that Inspired this miracle and nor the Faith of his servant
options: Jesus has the power to forgive sins
The Level of faith of the servant made Jesus heal him
The Salvation of God is universal
Even the sons of the Kingdom are not worthy of God's Kingdom

question: Josiah sent _____the priest to inquire of the Lord from Huldah
explanation: The priest and Shaphan, the secretary were both sent by Josiah to inquire of the Lord from prophetess Huldah the wife of Shallim, on the meaning of the book of law found in the temple.

question: St James teaching on impartiality centers on_________
explanation: The subject matter of St James "Impartiality" is predicated upon selflessness and equal treatment of all categories and class of persons, as much as should be done in the church and the general society
options: Giving the place of the rich to the poor and in the church
Loving our neighbours as ourselves in all situation
The rich spending their wealth on the poor for social equity
Christians not being partial to idle people

question: The name "Jezreel" is a representation of ______
explanation: Hosea named his first son Jezreel as a sign of the punishment to come upon the royal house
options: Victory upon the enemies of Israel
The Punishment to come unto the royal house
The broken covenant between God and Israel

question: Moses named the place where the Israelites drank water from the rock "Mesah and Meribah' particularly because---------
explanation: Moses called the place, "Massah and Meribah' because the Israelites put God to proof by saying, "Is the Lord among us or not?
options: They wanted to put the lord to test
They made him strike the rock angrily
The people had enough water to drink

question: Abraham's faith was reckoned to him as righteousness'. This underscores St Paul's admonition that ______
explanation: According to St Paul, Abraham was justified by faith and not by law, the implication of the Above statement
options: Redemption in Christ is possible through observance of the law
Justification is by faith and nor the law
Obedience of the law is unnecessary as compared to God's grace

question: St Paul's epistle to the Philippians on "Christian Giving' indicated his reception of gifts from them through________
explanation: Epaphroditus was the envoy of the Philippians and Colossians who brought gifts to Paul while he was in prison in Rome.

question: The intent of the their temptation of Christ was to_____________
explanation: By asking Jesus to fall down and bow to him, after showing him all the kingdoms of the world, Satan wanted Jesus to derail from his focus on the kingdom of God to the possession and control of his worldly kingdoms.
options: Make him focus on wordly possessions
Make him seem like a Magician
Make him see the riches of the world from a high mountain

question: According to St Paul, God sent the spirit of his son into men's heart-----
explanation: In ST Paul's teaching on Christians as sons and heirs of God, God sent the spirit of his Son into men's hearts crying. "Abba! Father!" and in effect making Christians sons and heirs of God rather being slaves
options: So that become and act like a God
For the Redemption of their Sins

question: "For the men in the ship knew that he was fleeing from the presence of the Lord". The person referred to in this statement is________
explanation: The statement points at Jonah's flee, boarding a ship to Tarshish, in refusal to preach God's message of repentance to Nineveh

question: St Paul's teaching on spiritual gifts was directed to _______
Cleopas' heart burnt within him on the road to Emmaus when Jesus ________
explanation: Cleopas, among other disciples felt embittered after Jesus appeared on the road to Emmaus teaching the scripture, but they didn't realize he was the resurrected Jesus until he disappeared

question: For how long did the Lord supply the children of Israel with manna in the wilderness?
explanation: The Israelites ate manna in the wilderness for forty years until they came to the border of the land of Canaan ( Exodus 16:35)

question: Only ...stated that the transfiguration took place eight days after Peter's confession of Jesus as the son of God.
explanation: The synoptic record of Luke added that Christ's transfiguration took place 8 days after the Peter confessed Jesus as the son of God. (Luke 9:28).

question: The Egyptians encamped at ____ when they pursued the Israelites
explanation: Pi-ha-hi-roth is the correct answer, the place where the Egyptians encamped in pursuit of the Israelites.

question: "I am the resurrection and the life, he who believes in me, though he dies, yet shall he live". Jesus directed this statement to
explanation: Martha is the correct answer. Jesus made the statement at the scene and setting of Lazarus' death

question: "Do not be afraid; for I know what you seek, Jesus who was crucified..." This statement was made__________
explanation: At the tomb, in a bid to anoint Jesus, Mary Salome, Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of James were told about the resurrection of Jesus. See-Mark 16:1.
options: to Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of James
to Mary Salome, Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of James

question: "What you sow does not come to life unless it dies". This was______
explanation: St. Paul used this statement as to charge Christians to logically respond to the unbelievers in Christ's resurrection.
options: the message of St. Paul's teaching on the second coming of Christ
made by St. Paul to Elymas, the magician
the statement of Jesus to Martha
the response St. Paul instructed Christians to give to those who doubt the resurrection of Christ

question: In the Gospel according to St. Matthew, Jesus sent His disciples to_______
explanation: Jesus sent the disciples to the lost sheep of the house of Israel, the Jews, according to the report of St. Matthew. (Matthew 10:5-6)

question: "Who do men say that the Son of man is?" Jesus asked this question
explanation: The emphasis of Jesus by asking the question in plainly in the context of the Great Confession and to show that popular thinking of the people doesn't count in honouring Him as a Messiah.
options: to show that popular opinion matters the most in His recognition as Messiah
to indicate that the Jews and Pharisees need to reckon with His Messiahship
at the scene of His Transfiguration
in the context of the Great Confession

question: God charged man to 'be fruitful, and multiply, and .... the earth, and subdue it'. (1st creation story)
explanation: The authoritative answer is 'replenish'. See- Genesis 1:28.

question: Since fervent prayers of the righteous has great power in its effects, Christians according to St. James must________
explanation: Christians must confess their sins before God and take conscious steps to forsake them as the prayer of the righteous answers fervently.

question: ... updated Nehemiah about the state of Jerusalem while he was ...
explanation: Hanai visited Nehemiah, a captive in Babylon and reported the state of Jerusalem to him.

question: When Jesus healed the paralytic, the anger of the scribes was aroused by His_______
explanation: The scribes were angered by Jesus' statement 'my son, your sins are forgiven' when He healed the paralytic. To them, such statement was blasphemous, as it is only God that can forgive sins.
options: refusal to show them signs of His divinity
nature of command to the paralytic
healing of the man on a Sabbath

question: "For I desire steadfast love and not sacrifice..." this statement relates to the_______
explanation: Response of Israel to the genuiness of God's love is the correct answer. In the message of Hosea on 'Divine Love', God issued the above statement to indicate that he prefered steadfast love to burnt offerings.
options: response of God's love to the children of Israel
response of Israel to the genuineness of God's love
message of God's love to man
message of Hosea on faithfulness and social progress

question: The most significant lesson at the scene of the Israelites' blame of Moses in their struggle and escape from Egypt is that___________
explanation: Moses' courage and confidence in God, even though there was to certainty of safety for the Israelites at the red sea as the Eyptians chased after them, is a stand-alone lesson to hold on to from the story.
options: God hardened the heart of Pharaoh to pursue the Israelites
they would have perfered to stay back and die in Egypt
Moses' courage and confidence in God saved the entire situation
Moses' height of anger and intolerance was revealed

question: When Ezekiel was called, he was shown a scroll on which were written words of______
explanation: In the preparation of Ezekiel to deliver God's message to Israel, God made him eat a scroll upon which there were written words of lamentation, mourning and woe.

question: The illustration of Satan, the adversary who prowls around seeking whom to devour, is particular to__________-
explanation: In St. Peter's teaching on humility, he advised that Christians be sober and watchful, for Satan, the adversary, prowls around seeking whom to devour.
options: St. Paul's teaching on the second coming of Christ
St. Peter's teaching on civic responsibility

question: Herod Agrippa persecuted Peter primarily to______
explanation: Seeing as Herod Agrippa's previous killing of James, pleased the Jews. He persecuted Peter also for the same reason, as he wanted to win the confidence of the Jews in his government.
options: contain the news about Jesus' resurrection
signal to the Apostles that he wouldn't tolerate them
obstruct the spread of the gospel

question: "Hosanna to the son of David! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord, Hosanna in the highest!" This was... account of the Triumphal Entry
explanation: Matthew's synoptic account (in Matthew 21:9) is the authoritative answer to this. N.B: paying attention to little details a true quality of an Art and CRS student.

question: The essence of St. Paul's teaching on Law and Grace is that___________
explanation: To St. Paul, strict observation of the law cannot guarantee salvation, what God truly rewards is faith, using the example of Abraham to support this.
options: observance of the law is necessary for redemption in Christ
what God truly rewards is the prayer for grace by Christians
observance of the law only isn't a guarantee of salvation
God's grace in Christians' lives shouldn't be a reason for continuing in sin

question: One of the following is not a quality of good discipleship_________
explanation: Exuberance is the best answer as lowliness in spirit, without too much vigour for worldness, is key to true discipleship.

question: At about the ... hour, Jesus cried with a loud voice "Eli Eli lama sabach - thani".
explanation: At about the ninth hour, Jesus cried with a loud voice 'My God, my God why has thou forsaken me.'

question: The Last Supper refers the last meal Jesus had with His disciples immediately before His_____
explanation: Jesus ate the Last Supper with His disciples before His betrayal and arrest.

question: Paul taught that spiritual gifts in all their varieties emanate from____________
explanation: According to St. Paul, all the nine spiritual gifts are inspired by the same Spirit (God) who apportions to individuals as He wills. However, their usage must be for the common good of the 'body of Christ.'

question: To St. James, a doer of the word of God must learn to also__________
explanation: According to St. James a doer of the word must learn to control his tongue, as anyone who cannot do this, deceives himself and his religion is in vain.
options: be a listener of the word of God

question: St. Paul on 'Civic Responsibility' advised Christians not only to be law-abiding but also_________
explanation: St. Paul advised that Christians be law-abiding as well as discharge their duties and obligation to the constituted authorities i.e payment of taxes, giving respect to whom respect is due etc.
options: to provide moral advice to those in authority
do what is expected of them

question: Which of the following was Pilate's question to Jesus at his trial?
explanation: 'Are you the king of the Jews?' Pilate asked Jesus at His trial.
options: Are you Jesus, the prophet from Galilee?
Are you the king of the Jews?
What is it that these men testify against you?

question: According to Jeremiah, the Lord's new covenant will be made with the house of ... and the house of__________
explanation: According to the book of Jeremiah, the Lord will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and the house of Judah.

question: Joseph's leadership quality was so exceptional so much that__________
explanation: Other nations of the world benefited from the exceptional leadership skills of Joseph -Egypt was the land of plenty sought after by other nations in the time of severe famine.
options: the Chief butler recommended him to Pharaoh
God rewarded his action of committing adultery with Potiphar's wife
Pharaoh had to appoint him as Emperor
other nations of the world benefited from it

question: Nebuchadnezzer king of Babylon invaded Jerusalem and carried away all the treasures of the temple during the reign of_________
explanation: Jehoiachin is the correct answer. Nebuchadnezzer's invasion of Jerusalem occured during his reign.

question: In Matthew's account, John the Baptist's immediate reaction when Jesus came to be baptized was to_______
explanation: John the Baptist asked that he should rather be baptized by Jesus. (Matthew 3:14)
options: ask that Jesus should rather baptize him
ask why he should baptize a non-sinner
wait for the promise of the manifestation of God's glory

question: Peter refuted the mockery of drunkenness of the disciples by referring to the prophecy of________
explanation: "... but this is what was spoken of by the Prophet Joel", Peter said, when people mocked the disciples of drunkiness while speaking in tongues.
